vocabulary.definition: a software tool or technique used to take advantage of a vulnerability in a computer system
vocabulary.example: The hackers used an exploit to gain unauthorized access to the database.

vocabulary.definition: a set of values that determines the position of a point in a particular system
vocabulary.example: The GPS system uses coordinates to pinpoint locations on the map.

vocabulary.definition: a robbery or theft, especially one involving a large sum of money or valuable items
vocabulary.example: The criminals planned a daring heist on the bank vault.

vocabulary.definition: capable of being reversed or undone
vocabulary.example: The damage to the painting was reversible and could be restored by a skilled conservator.
The toy store had a variety of novelties that caught the children's attention.

vocabulary.definition: having or showing a strong desire and determination to succeed
vocabulary.example: She embarked on an ambitious project to build a sustainable eco-village.
